definitions.example: My cousin is such a dear, always drawing me pictures.

definitions.definition: An affectionate, familiar term of address, such as used between husband and wife.
definitions.example: Pass me the salt, would you dear?
The dearer the jewel, the greater the love expressed.
Such dear embrace tenderly comforts even in this dear sorrow.

definitions.definition: Precious to or greatly valued by someone.
definitions.example: The dearer the giver, the dearer the trinket he brings!

definitions.definition: A formal way to start (possibly after my) addressing somebody at the beginning of a letter, memo etc.
definitions.example: Dear Sir/Madam/Miss, please notice our offices will be closed during the following bank holidays: [...].

definitions.definition: A formal way to start (often after my) addressing somebody one likes or regards kindly.
definitions.example: My dear friend, I feel better as soon as you come sit beside my sickbed!

definitions.definition: An ironic way to start (often after my) addressing an inferior.
definitions.example: My dear boy, if your grades don't pick up I won't bounce you on but over my knee!
The Christens found the heathens dear, as the lion doth the bear.
